description: A bustling port town built where the Silver River meets the sea. Its docks teem with sailors and merchants, and the smell of salt and fish hangs heavy in the air.
name: Portbridge

fish_market.description: An open-air market dominated by stalls selling the day's catch. Fishermen haggle loudly over prices, and the ground is slick with seawater.
fish_market.name: Fish Market

fishing_pier.description: A smaller pier used by the local fishermen. Their colorful, smaller boats are tied up here.
fishing_pier.name: Fishing Pier

harbor_district.description: This is the heart of the harbor. A large, rowdy inn, The Sailor's Rest, dominates the west side of the street, while the main docks stretch out to the east.
harbor_district.name: Harbor District

harbor_road_south.description: Warehouses and small taverns line the cobbled streets leading north towards the noisy docks. Sailors shout, gulls cry, and the air is thick with the smell of tar and fish.
harbor_road_south.name: Harbor Road

inn_upper_floor.description: A narrow corridor above the Sailor's Rest, lined with doors to small, basic rooms for rent.
inn_upper_floor.name: Inn - Upper Floor

lumber_storage.description: Huge stacks of timber and planks are stored here under canvas tarps, ready for use by the shipwrights.
lumber_storage.name: Lumber Storage

main_pier.description: A long wooden pier extending out over the water. Large merchant vessels are tied up, and dockhands rush to load and unload cargo.
main_pier.name: Main Pier

port_authority_office.description: A stern-looking building where harbourmasters manage dock traffic and collect tariffs. A sign on the door reads 'Official Business Only'.
port_authority_office.name: Port Authority Office

sailors_rest_inn_common.description: The common room is filled with loud conversation, laughter, and the occasional sea shanty. A staircase leads to the rooms above.
sailors_rest_inn_common.name: The Sailor's Rest - Common Room

sailors_rest_inn_exterior.description: The entrance to a large, rowdy inn catering to seafarers. Loud conversation and the clatter of tankards can be heard from within.
sailors_rest_inn_exterior.name: The Sailor's Rest Inn

shipwright_road.description: This wide road is covered in wood shavings and smells of pitch and sawdust. It leads north to the massive shipwright's yard.
shipwright_road.name: Shipwright's Road

shipwright_yard.description: The sounds of sawing and hammering fill the air. The massive wooden skeletons of ships under construction dominate the yard.
shipwright_yard.name: Shipwright's Yard

smugglers_crossroads.description: The tunnel splits here, leading west towards what might be the inn's cellar and north to a storage area.
smugglers_crossroads.name: Tunnel Crossroads

smugglers_tunnel.description: A narrow, damp tunnel running beneath the harbor district. It smells of seawater and stale air. The tunnel continues north.
smugglers_tunnel.name: Smuggler's Tunnel

smugglers_tunnel_entrance.description: Hidden behind a stack of loose crates near the main harbor is a dark, grimy opening leading down into the ground.
smugglers_tunnel_entrance.name: Hidden Tunnel Entrance

town_center_portbridge.description: The central area of Portbridge is slightly more orderly than the harbor. Merchant stalls and administrative buildings cluster around a small square.
town_center_portbridge.name: Portbridge Town Center

town_gate_north.description: A sturdy wooden gatehouse guards the northern entrance to Portbridge. Two guards in the town's livery eye newcomers warily. Beyond the gate, the town looks busy and somewhat rough.
town_gate_north.name: Portbridge North Gate

underground_cache.description: The tunnel opens into a small, dry chamber where illicit goods are stored. A single, locked chest sits in the corner.
underground_cache.name: Underground Cache
